statistics.name: freeThrows
statistics.description: Free Throw makes and attempts.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.name: minutes
statistics.description: The total number of minutes played.

statistics.name: assistTurnoverRatio
statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover

statistics.name: rebounds
statistics.description: The total number of rebounds (offensive and defensive).

statistics.name: defensiveRebounds
statistics.description: The number of times when the defense obtains the possession of the ball after a missed shot by the offense.

statistics.name: offensiveRebounds
statistics.description: The number of times when the offense obtains the possession of the ball after a missed shot.

header.gameNote: GOSSNER FOODS CLASSIC AT LOGAN UT

article.headline: Binghamton 59, Idaho State 46
article.story: LOGAN, Utah (AP) -- Andre Heard scored 17 points to lead Binghamton to a 59-46 victory over Idaho State Thursday night in the opening round of the Gossner Foods Holiday Classic. Binghamton will play in the championship game Friday night against Utah State, which beat Arkansas-Little Rock 76-44 in the second game Thursday night. Binghamton (3-8) was 10-of-14 from the free-throw line in the final three minutes of the game to preserve the win. Idaho State (7-3) was plagued by 21 turnovers in the game and was only 13-of-23 in free throws for the game. ISU was led by Matt Stucki and Kasey Winters with nine points each. Troy Hailey also dropped in 14 points for Binghamton. Trailing by as many as 14 points midway through the second half, the Bengals were able narrow the Bearcats lead to 52-46 with 2:23 remaining on a backdoor lay-in by Matt Schroeder. But frantic defensive pressure by ISU sent the Bearcats to the line where BU was able to seal the game. A low-scoring first half was marked by 13 Bengal turnovers, though the Bearcats only shot 12-of-36. A steal and subsequent dunk by Mike Gordon in the final minute of the opening half gave Binghamton a 34-22 halftime edge. ISU's leading scorer (17.4 ppg) Slim Millien was held to five points in the opening half, seven for the game. The Bearcats outrebounded the Bengals 45-33.
